Subject: diagnostic protocol
Value: A protocol that describes which diagnostic test or tests will be used to identify animals (or another epidemiological unit) infected with a specific pathogen, possibly in more than one round of screening.@en

Subject: diagnostic protocol
Value: A protocol to be used within a surveillance activity to classify epidemiological units according to a specific outcome.@en

Value: A sampling strategy in which population units are chosen for investigation into a disease cluster or outbreak.@en

Surveillance Activity
Value: a planned process which systematically, continuously or repeatedly measures, collected, collates, analyses, interprets and disseminates  health and welfare related data from defined populations.@en

Subject: livestock farming system
Value: a role given to a specific herd of domesticated animals, specifying that they are raised in an agricultural setting with a specific purpose.@en

Value: a specimen collected from an organism.@en

Value: a collection of properties used to assign numeric results to a surveillance activity@en

Subject: CRAC 2.4.1. Sampled population
Value:
\"This sub-section specifies the population(s) that were sampled.
\"@en

Subject: CRAC 3.2. Practical support activities
CRAC 3.4. Practical aspects on information handling
Value:
\"This section describes how the collected lab data and metadata were loaded into a suitable electronic environment for further processing. 
It may include a description of manual or automatic data capture processes that were applied to extract e.g. metadata from paper questionnaires, or converting the formats of files or encoding the variables received. It may also include analysis of the metadata and paradata associated with collection to ensure the collection activities have met requirements. It might also describe how physical samples or related material (questionnaires) will be archived. When software is used for data collection the version and software archiving should be described.\"@en

Subject: CRAC 4.1. Data integration
CRAC 4.2. Data classification / encoding
Value:
\"This section describes if data/variables were classified and/or encoded. Examples:
- Automatic coding routines that assign numeric codes to text responses according to a pre-determined statistical classification. 
- Classification based on analytical results (e.g. MLST pattern), bioinformatics analysis (e.g. phylogenetic trees) or mathematical models (PCA, SVM / ANN)\"@en

Subject: CRAC 4.4. Data cleansing and correction
Value:
\"This section describes what action was taken for incorrect, missing, unreliable or outdated data. For example new values may have been inserted or outdated data may have been removed. It should describe whether data were added or changed, the method used, and the flags used to mark them as changed.
\"@en

Subject: CRAC 5.2. Surveillance output validation
European Food Safety Agency Standard Sample Description Framework - EFSA SSD
Value: annotations created to map specific entities to their origin in the Standard Sample Description, a terminology catalogue maintained by the European Foos Safety Agency (EFSA).  https://www.efsa.europa.eu/en/efsajournal/pub/3424@en

Subject: specimen weight
Value: the weight of a specific collected specimen. use sub-properties to specify weight units@en

Subject: sampling weight in grams
Value: the weight of a specific collected specimen, in grams@en

Subject: sampling weight in millilitre
Value: the weight of a specific collected specimen, in mililitres@en

Subject: contains information about
Value: this property allows a dataset to be explictly linked to any entities within it which can be referred to with an unique ID.@en

Subject: food-borne outbreak investigation
Value: a type of outbreak investigation that focus specifically on foodborne agents/vehicles@en

Subject: FBO investigation
Value: a surveillance activity with the specific surveillance context of investigating a foodborne outbreak@en

Subject: Cluster/Outbreak investigation
Value: a specific type of surveillance activity which has as surveillance context an outbreak investigation@en

Subject: reporting country
Value: this property specifies specifically whic country is responsible for the documentation about a specific surveillance activity@en

Subject: status of hazard presence in a geographical region
Value: a quality that specifies the known status of a hazard occurrence in a given geograhial region.@en
